column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We ordered personal pizzas so we could try two varieties - The Classic
column2: and The Lou.  To be honest
column4: and I was not sure what we'd be getting into.  I was expecting something very heavy and stuffed with cheese.  I also normally don't like red pizzas (I love a good white
column5: veggie) because I find them overwhelmingly tomato-y
column6: but these were lovely - very light
column7: you could taste the fresh tomato (but it wasn't too much)
column8: and the portions were just right.  For the Classic - I'm not usually a fan of sausage either since usually it's an overpowering flavor
column9: but this was very subtle and worked nicely.
